page.title: 12Destratification (2)
page.content:
When this condition develops large algal populations can proliferate in the epilmnion.In addition deoxygenation in the hypolimnion results in the formation of ammonia and sulphides and causes naturally occurring iron and manganese to be taken into solution.
To control these conditions the water in the reservoir can be mixed using an air lift system comprising of a curtain of small bubbles continually rising to the surface. The bubbles are produced from a compressor pumping air into a closed pipe laid in the bottom of the reservoir which has 0.5 mm diameterholes at 0.3m intervals. Wimbleball and Clatworthy have this destratification facility.
